questions.question: Who has resigned as the Managing Director and CEO of Paytm Payments Bank?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Surinder Chawla. In News
  • Surinder Chawla has resigned as the Managing Director and CEO of Paytm Payments Bank.
Key Points
  • His resignation, effective from June 26, 2024, was announced by Paytm on April 8, 2024.
  • Chawla cited personal reasons and a desire to explore better career prospects for his resignation.
  • Prior to joining PPBL, Chawla served as Head - Branch Banking at RBL Bank, focusing on expanding the CASA base and fee revenue.
  • Chawla's resignation comes amid Paytm Payments Bank facing prohibitory action from the Reserve Bank of India.
  • Paytm has not disclosed any information regarding Chawla's potential successor.

questions.question: Where will the maritime cooperative activity involving the defense forces of the US, Japan, Australia, and the Philippines take place?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is South China Sea. In News
  • The maritime cooperative activity involving the defense forces of the US, Japan, Australia, and the Philippines will take place in the South China Sea.
Key Points
  • Specifically, the activity will occur in Manila's exclusive economic zone (EEZ) in the South China Sea.
  • Participating vessels include the USS Mobile, HMAS Warramunga, JS Akebono, and two Philippine warships.
  • The activity aims to strengthen the interoperability of the countries' armed forces and support a free and open Indo-Pacific.
  • The joint statement reaffirms the final and legally binding nature of the 2016 South China Sea Arbitral Tribunal Award.
  • This initiative comes amid rising tensions in the region due to China's growing assertiveness and territorial disputes.

questions.question: What is the name of the system developed by the Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) to bolster the Indian Army's air defence capabilities under the 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' initiative?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Akashteer Control and Reporting System

In News

  • The Indian Army has initiated the induction of control and reporting systems as part of 'Project Akashteer' to enhance its air defense capabilities, aiming to provide an unparalleled level of situational awareness and control.

Key Points

  • 'Project Akashteer' is geared towards ensuring the safety of friendly aircraft and engaging hostile ones in contested airspace.
  • This initiative falls within the broader context of the 'Year of Technology Infusion' in 2024, signaling the Army's commitment to bolstering its technological capabilities.
  • Developed by Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) under the 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' initiative, 'Akashteer' seeks to digitize air defense control and reporting processes, enhancing operational efficiency and integration.
  • The deployment of 'Akashteer' commenced with the dispatch of the first batch of control centers from BEL-Ghaziabad, indicating the tangible progress of the project.
  • 2024 has been declared as the 'Year of Technology Absorption' by the Indian Army, reflecting its commitment to integrating niche technologies and systems into its inventory to meet present and future defense requirements.

questions.question: The International Day of Sport for Development and Peace is celebrated annually on 6 April to drive social change, community development and to foster peace and understanding. What is the theme of the day for 2024?
options: Sport as a lever for Education and Social Change
Sport for the Promotion of Peaceful and Inclusive Societies
Securing a Sustainable and Peaceful Future for All: The Contribution of Sport
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Sport for the Promotion of Peaceful and Inclusive Societies.

In News

  • The International Day of Sport for Development and Peace is celebrated annually on 6 April to drive social change, community development and to foster peace and understanding.

Key Points

  • Created by the United Nations General Assembly in 23 August 2013, supported by the International Olympic Committee since 6 April 2014.
  • On 23 August 2013, the United Nations General Assembly in a resolution decided to proclaim on 6 April as the "International Day of the Sport for the Development and the Peace".
  • This date commemorates the inauguration, in 1896, of the first Olympic games of the modern era, in Athens, (Greece).

Additional Information

  • The International Olympic Committee (IOC) is a non-governmental sports organisation based in Lausanne, Switzerland.
    • It is constituted in the form of an association under the Swiss Civil Code (articles 60–79).
    • Founded in 1894 by Pierre de Coubertin and Demetrios Vikelas, it is the authority responsible for organising the modern (Summer, Winter, and Youth) Olympic Games.
    • President: Thomas Bach

questions.question: What is the name of Zimbabwe's new gold-backed currency?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is ZiG. In News
  • Zimbabwe's new gold-backed currency, Zimbabwe Gold (ZiG), started trading to address high inflation concerns.
Key Points
  • It was launched with an initial exchange rate of 13.56 ZiG to $1, replacing the Real Time Gross Settlement Dollar (RTGS).
  • The RTGS had experienced significant devaluation, losing about 80% of its value before the currency change.
  • Bank balances were transitioned into ZiG over the weekend, with customers given a 21-day period to complete the process.
  • New ZiG banknotes are set to enter circulation by the end of the month, as per the Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe's statement.
  • The RTGS, also known as the Zimdollar, was introduced in 2019 following a decade of dollarization.
  • Despite efforts to stabilize the currency, annual inflation exceeded 55% in March, raising concerns of hyperinflation reminiscent of the 2007-2009 era.

Additional Information

  • Zimbabwe is a landlocked country in southern Africa known for its dramatic landscape and diverse wildlife, much of it within parks, reserves and safari areas.
  • On the Zambezi River, Victoria Falls make a thundering 108m drop into narrow Batoka Gorge, where there’s white-water rafting and bungee-jumping.
  • Downstream are Matusadona and Mana Pools national parks, home to hippos, rhinos and birdlife.
  • Capital: Harare
  • Official languages: Shona, Tshwa, English, Xhosa, etc.
  • Population: 1.63 crores (2022).

questions.question: Ban Sagar Dam is built on which river ?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Son.

  • Bansagar Dam is the multipurpose river valley project on son river in the Madhya Pradesh State of India with both irrigation and 435 Mega Watt of hydroelectric power generation.

questions.question: Which country recently held its first parliamentary election under the new leadership of Emir Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Kuwait

In News

  • Kuwait held its first parliamentary election since Sheikh Meshal al-Ahmad al-Sabah became Emir, with a focus on pushing economic reforms amid longstanding deadlock between appointed governments and elected parliaments.

Key Points

  • The new Emir criticized the National Assembly and the government in his inaugural speech, accusing them of harming the country's interests.
  • The protracted feud between appointed governments and the elected parliament has hindered fiscal reform, including the passage of a debt law crucial for accessing international markets and reducing reliance on oil revenues.
  • Voting took place in the fourth election since December 2020, with Kuwait banning political parties and candidates running as independents.
  • Sheikh Meshal, aged 83, succeeded his late brother in December and dissolved parliament in February, citing the assembly's violation of constitutional principles.
  • Kuwait's assembly holds significant influence compared to similar bodies in other Gulf monarchies, but political deadlock has led to frequent cabinet reshuffles and parliament dissolutions.
  • The election saw 200 candidates competing, the lowest in over five decades, with an estimated 835,000 voters across five electoral districts, each electing 10 lawmakers.

questions.question: Which countries explored ways to expand cooperation in areas of energy, critical minerals, technology, and counter-terrorism at their first '2+2' defence and foreign ministerial dialogue?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is India and Brazil

In News

  • India and Brazil held their first-ever '2+2' defence and foreign ministerial dialogue, discussing cooperation in various key areas.
Key Points
  • The discussions included expanding cooperation in energy, critical minerals, technology, and counter-terrorism.
  • The '2+2' dialogue involves the participation of defense and foreign ministers from both countries to address strategic, security-related, and diplomatic issues.
  • India conducts '2+2' dialogues with other strategic partners like the US, Australia, Japan, and Russia.
  • The US holds the oldest and most significant '2+2' partnership dialogue with India.

questions.question: Where will the 14-member Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF) bloc host an investor forum for domestic climate tech entrepreneurs to pitch their products to global investors?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Singapore

In News

  • The International Platform on Environment and Finance (IPEF) is set to host a Clean Economy Investor Forum in Singapore, aimed at bolstering sustainable growth within the renewable energy sector.

Key Points

  • The forum intends to bring together investors and stakeholders interested in supporting clean energy initiatives.
  • It will serve as a platform for discussing investment opportunities, challenges, and strategies to accelerate the transition towards a cleaner and more sustainable economy.
  • Key topics expected to be addressed include:
    • Investment trends and opportunities in renewable energy projects
    • Financial instruments and mechanisms for financing clean energy initiatives
    • Policy frameworks and regulatory incentives to promote sustainable growth
    • Case studies showcasing successful clean energy investments and projects
  • By convening investors and industry experts, the forum aims to facilitate dialogue and collaboration to drive investments in renewable energy and contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.

questions.question: In February 2024, the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) notified Amendments to PFRDA (Retirement Adviser) Regulations 2016 with effect from 20th February 2024. An application for grant of certificate of registration should be disposed of by PFRDA within  ____________ (days).
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 30 days.

In News

  • PFRDA notifies amendments to Retirement Adviser (RA) regulations for Good Governance and ease of compliance

Key Points

  • The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has notified the Retirement Adviser (RA) (Amendment) Regulations, 2023 on 20.02.2024.
  • The amendments to Retirement Adviser Regulations simplify the provisions related to eligibility criteria, timelines to expedite the process of registration, and removal of the requirement of submission of security deposits with an objective of Ease of Doing Business.
  • An application for a grant of certificate of registration should be disposed of by PFRDA within 30 days.
  • Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority made changes to the PFRDA (Retirement Adviser) Regulations 2016 with effect from 20th February.
  • Non Individual applicants regulated by other financial regulators, like RBI, SEBI, or IRDAI are now eligible to become RAs
  • The amendment removed the requirement for the submission of security deposits.

Additional Information

  • Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA)
    • Established in - 2003
    • HQ - New Delhi
    • CEO - Kamal Chaudhry

questions.question: Where is Blackbuck National Park located?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Gujarat.

  • Blackbuck National Park is located in Gujarat.

Key Points

  • The sanctuary was established in July 1976, as an initial protected area of about 18 sq km.
  • In 1980, another 16 sq km were added to increase the total area to 34 sq km.
  • The park is surrounded Gulf of Khambhat on the south and by wastelands and agriculture fields on the other sides.
  • It was the grassland of the Maharaja of the princely state of Bhavnagar.
  • The National park has been classified as a 4B Gujarat-Rajwada biotic province of a semi-arid bio-geographical zone.

Additional Information

  • The top 5 National Parks of Gujarat for Wildlife Sanctuaries are:
    • Gir National Park.
    • Marine National Park.
    • Jambughoda Wildlife Sanctuary.
    • Barda Wildlife Sanctuary.
    • Purna Wildlife Sanctuary.

Important Points

questions.question: In March 2024, which of the following banks is Not settled with the capital markets regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI), paying a total of Rs 39.36 lakh as settlement charges?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Standard Chartered plc.

In News

  • HDFC Bank, HSBC, Citi Bank, and Deutsche Bank settle with SEBI over FPI rules violations

Key Points

  • Four major banks, namely HDFC Bank, HSBC, Citi Bank, and Deutsche Bank AG have reached a settlement with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) regarding allegations of non-compliance with eligibility criteria outlined in the Foreign Portfolio Investors rules.
  • In total, these institutions have paid a sum of Rs 39.36 lakh as settlement charges.
  • Specifically, Deutsche Bank AG contributed Rs 11.05 lakh, the Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Ltd paid Rs 10.87 lakh, HDFC Bank remitted Rs 9.18 lakh, and Citi Bank NA paid Rs 8.25 lakh towards the settlement.
  • This resolution follows the submission of four settlement applications by the concerned parties, proposing to resolve the matter without accepting or denying the findings of fact and conclusions of law, through a settlement order.

Additional Information

  • Standard Chartered plc
    • ​Founded in - 1853
    • HQ - London
    • CHairman - Jose Vinals
  • SEBI
    • ​Established in - 1988
    • HQ - Mumbai
    • Chairman - Madhabi Puri Buch

questions.question: What is the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) repo rate as of the recent Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting in April 2024?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 6.5 percent

In News

  • The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has maintained the key repo rate at 6.5 percent for the seventh consecutive meeting, prioritizing the control of retail inflation, which has exceeded the 4 percent target.

Key Points

  • The repo rate, crucial for banks borrowing funds from the RBI to address short-term liquidity mismatches, remains unchanged at 6.5 percent, as announced by Governor Shaktikanta Das.
  • The decision to maintain the repo rate was made by a majority vote of 5:1 within the MPC, signaling a continuation of the stance of 'withdrawal of accommodation'.
  • Governor Das emphasized the need for vigilant monitoring of prices of essential commodities like vegetables and fruits due to the forecast of above-normal temperatures during April-June, aiming to mitigate volatility in the market.
  • The article highlights the positive outlook for agriculture and rural activity, anticipating an upturn in rural demand and an improvement in employment conditions, which is expected to stimulate private consumption.

questions.question: Which Indian Naval Ship was awarded the 'On the Spot Unit Citation' by Admiral R Hari Kumar, Chief of the Naval Staff, for successful conduct of anti-piracy operations?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is INS Sharda

In News

  • INS Sharda was awarded the 'On the Spot Unit Citation' by Admiral R Hari Kumar, Chief of the Naval Staff, for successful conduct of anti-piracy operations.

Key Points

  • Admiral R Hari Kumar, Chief of the Naval Staff, visited the Southern Naval Command in Kochi and awarded the 'On the Spot Unit Citation' to INS Sharda for its successful conduct of anti-piracy operations.
  • INS Sharda was tasked with investigating the Iranian fishing vessel Omari, suspected to be hijacked by pirates off the East coast of Somalia.
  • The ship intercepted the vessel and maintained surveillance throughout the night, launching its helo and Prahar team in the early morning hours of February 2, 2024.
  • The aggressive stance of the ship coerced the pirates to release all 19 crew members (11 Iranian & 08 Pakistani) of the fishing vessel safely.
  • The swift and decisive actions of INS Sharda led to the rescue of the hijacked fishing vessel and its crew from Somali pirates, saving precious lives at sea.

questions.question: Which company recently launched niia.ai, a generative AI-driven platform for the apparel and fashion industry?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Navan AI

In News

  • niia.ai leverages the power of generative AI to offer significant time and cost savings to apparel designers.

Key Points

  • Traditionally, the apparel design process involves multiple steps, taking weeks to complete. However, with niia.ai, this process is condensed into fewer steps, allowing designers to bring their ideas to market in a matter of hours.
  • The platform enables designers to create design variations or entirely new designs simply by describing their ideas. It offers visualization features that provide a 360-degree view of the product and allows designers to "try out" the design on AI-generated fashion models, generating photoshoot-quality images.
  • By eliminating the need to physically produce samples of designs, niia.ai not only saves money but also contributes to sustainability efforts by reducing waste in the apparel design process.
  • Santosh Rout, Founder and CEO of Navan AI, expressed excitement about the launch of niia.ai, highlighting its transformative potential for designers of all scales, from individual designers to large apparel brands.
  • The platform's low-cost Software as a Service (SaaS) pricing model aims to democratize apparel design, empowering designers with speed, efficiency, and cost-effectiveness.
  • The Indian fashion market, experiencing rapid growth, presents a significant opportunity for technology-driven solutions like niia.ai. With the market expected to reach over USD 125 billion by 2025, niia.ai aims to play a crucial role in the sector's transformation by providing designers with the tools they need to capitalize on this growth.

questions.question: Which country retained the top spot for the best place to conduct business for the 16th consecutive year according to the EIU report?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Singapore

In News

  • According to the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) business environment ranking, Singapore, Denmark, and the United States are considered the best places in the world to conduct business.
Key Points

  • The ranking is based on indicators such as inflation, cost of living, economic growth, and fiscal policies, providing insights into the attractiveness of doing business across 82 countries and territories.
  • Singapore has consistently topped the list for the past 16 years, attributed to factors such as political stability and the government's focus on assisting domestic private-sector companies in technological upgrades.
  • The EIU's analysts highlight that the ranking serves as an effective tool for identifying which economies are better positioned for growth and where an increase in investment spending may soon occur.
  • Notable "big improvers" in the index include countries like Greece, Qatar, and India, indicating improvements in their business environments.
  • Singapore has also hinted at potential measures for unvaccinated travelers, such as longer quarantine periods and additional testing, reflecting its commitment to managing public health amidst global uncertainties.

questions.question: Which ISRO mission team was honored with the 2024 John L ‘Jack’ Swigert Jr. award for space exploration by the Space Foundation?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Chandrayaan-3 Mission

In News

  • ISRO’s Chandrayaan-3 mission team has been honored with the 2024 John L ‘Jack’ Swigert Jr. Award for space exploration by the Space Foundation in the US.

Key Points

  • The John L ‘Jack’ Swigert Jr. Award is presented annually to celebrate significant achievements in space exploration by space agencies, companies, or consortia of organizations.
  • The award ceremony took place during the Space Symposium’s annual opening ceremony in Colorado on April 8, with DC Manjunath, Consul General of India in Houston, accepting the award on behalf of ISRO’s Chandrayaan team.
  • Heather Pringle, CEO of the Space Foundation, commended India’s leadership in space and praised the technical and engineering excellence demonstrated by the Chandrayaan-3 mission.

Additional Information

  • The John L ‘Jack’ Swigert Jr. Award is named after astronaut John L ‘Jack’ Swigert Jr., a significant figure in space exploration history.
  • Previous recipients of this prestigious award include NASA, the University of Arizona OSIRIS-REx team, the teams behind the NASA JPL Mars Ingenuity Helicopter and InSight-Mars Cube One missions, as well as the NASA Dawn and Cassini missions.
  • The Space Foundation, established in 1983, is a nonprofit organization that provides information, education, and collaboration opportunities for the global space ecosystem.
  • India’s successful landing of a spacecraft on the Moon’s South Pole in September of the previous year solidified its position as a key player in lunar exploration, alongside other major spacefaring nations such as the US, Russia, and China.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book "From A Car Shed To The Corner Room & Beyond"?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is S Raman. In News
  • The author of "From A Car Shed To The Corner Room & Beyond" is S Raman.
Key Points
  • Raman retired as the Chairman and Managing Director of Canara Bank and as a wholetime Member of the board of SEBI.
  • The book explores the intricate dance between personal integrity, professional challenges, and systemic issues in the financial world.
  • Raman's career trajectory, starting from a clerk with SBI to the top positions in various banks, is detailed in the book.
  • The autobiography provides insights into the challenges faced by public sector bankers, particularly in decision-making regarding high-value credit.
  • Raman's narrative is philosophical, covering unique vignettes from his 46-year-long illustrious career.

questions.question: Which Indian government scheme aims to install rooftop solar systems on 10 million houses?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is ​Pradhan Mantri Suryodaya Yojana.

Key Points

Pradhanmantri Suryoday Yojana:

  • Pradhanmantri Suryodaya Yojana aims to provide electricity to low and middle-income individuals through solar rooftop installations, along with offering additional income for surplus electricity generation.
  • The Prime Minister also directed that a massive national campaign should be started to mobilize residential segment consumers to adopt rooftop solar in large numbers.
  • PM Modi announces solar roof-top scheme for one crore (10 million) households.
  • The Pradhan Mantri Suryodaya Yojana aims to rapidly expand rooftop solar capacity by installing solar power systems on one crore houses.
  • It will provide incentives and financial assistance to make it affordable for residential consumers to adopt rooftop solar.
  • This scheme comes after India missed its initial target of 40 gigawatts of rooftop solar capacity by 2022 under the existing Rooftop Solar Programme (This was launched in year 2014).
  • The new scheme signals renewed impetus to achieve the target of 40GW capacity by the extended deadline of 2026.
  • To make India self-reliant in the field of energy will be one of the objectives of this scheme.
  • In 2014, the government launched the Rooftop Solar Programme that aimed to achieve a cumulative installed capacity of 40,000 megawatts.
  • With only around 11GW currently installed, the Pradhan Mantri Suryodaya Yojana intends to accelerate rooftop solar adoption.

Additional Information

  • Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana scheme was launched on 28th August 2014 by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
    • Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana is a National Mission on Financial Inclusion and provides banking services to all households in the country.
    • It also entered into the Guinness Book of World Records for having most bank accounts opened in one week.
    • The scheme sought to financially empower the poor by providing them access to the formal banking system.
  • Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
    • Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana was launched by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi on 1 May 2016 in Ballia, Uttar Pradesh.
    • Under this scheme, 5 Cr LPG connections will be provided to BPL families with a support of Rs.1600 per connection in the next 3 years.
    • Ensuring women’s empowerment, especially in rural India, the connections will be issued in the name of women of the households.
    • Rs. 8000 Cr. has been allocated towards the implementation of the scheme.
    • Identification of the BPL families will be done through Soci- Economic Caste Census Data.
  • Ayushman Bharat(PM-JAY) is a national health protection scheme that covers 10 crore vulnerable families and provides Rs 5 lakh per family per year for hospitalization.
    • It was launched in 2018.
    • NHA is responsible for implementing the PM-JAY(Jan Aarogya Yojana).
    • CEO of NHA : Dr. R.S. Sharma
    • Union Minister for Health & Family welfare : Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya

questions.question: Who has been elected as the Chairman of the Indian Banks' Association (IBA) for the term 2023-24?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is M V Rao

In News

  • Matam Venkata Rao, Managing Director and CEO of Central Bank of India, has been elected as the Chairman of the Indian Banks Association (IBA) for the term 2023-24.
Key Points
  • Rao's election took place during a meeting of the Managing Committee of IBA held on Thursday.
  • The three Deputy Chairmen for IBA are Dinesh Kumar Khara, Chairman of State Bank of India (SBI); S L Jain, MD and CEO of Indian Bank; and N Kamakodi, Managing Director and CEO of City Union Bank.
  • Madhav Nair, Country Head and CEO of Bank of Bahrain and Kuwait, has been appointed as the Honorary Secretary of the Association.

questions.question:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options:

Recognition very often goes to those at the top of the pecking order and stays there. Credit seldom trickles down to the worker at the bottom. The World Health Organization’s act of recognizing India’s ASHA (accredited social health activists) and the polio workers of Afghanistan is an attempt to right that wrong. It is a rare, and commendable doffing of the hat for workers at the very bottom of the rung, and gives credit where it is due. When WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus announced the names of six Global Health Leader awardees at the opening session of the World Health Assembly, over one million ASHAs and eight volunteer polio workers found themselves being counted amidst people leading from the front. The other awardees are Paul Farmer, co-founder of the NGO Partners in Health, Ahmed Hankir, a British-Lebanese psychiatrist, Ludmila Sofia Oliveira Varela, a youth sports advocate, and Yōhei Sasakawa, WHO’s Goodwill Ambassador for Leprosy Elimination. Dr. Tedros who picks the awardees himself said that the award recognizes those who have made an outstanding contribution to protecting and promoting health around the world, at a time when the world is facing an unprecedented convergence of inequity, conflict, food insecurity, climate crisis, and a pandemic.

The ASHAs were honored for their “crucial role in linking the community with the health system, to ensure those living in rural poverty can access primary health care services....” These workers, all women, faced harassment and violence for their work during the pandemic, well documented in the media. While the pandemic rewrote the rules, creating danger where mere routine existed, it must be stressed that in general, their job, which takes them into difficult-to-reach places and hostile communities, confers a measure of privations. Even as they contribute to better health outcomes, this workforce continues to protest across the country, for better remuneration, health benefits, and permanent posts. The eight volunteer polio workers of Afghanistan (four of them women) were shot and killed by gunmen in Takhar and Kunduz provinces in February 2022. Their work was crucial in a country where wild poliovirus type 1 is still circulating, WHO recorded. Clearly, certain kinds of basic public health work are fraught with perils on several continents across the world. It is the duty of the governmental agencies that employ them to ensure their welfare, safety, and security. While cheerleading about the award is rightfully reaching a crescendo, what matters is how the Indian government serves its last-mile health workers who are its feet on the ground, once the dust raised by their unexpected recognition has settled down.

Choose the antonym of the word 'Seldom'.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'Often.'

Key Points

  • The word 'Seldom' means Not often; rarely.
    • Example: Karan had seldom seen him so angry.
  • Let's look at the meaning of the given options:-
    • Scarcely - Used to suggest that something is unlikely to be or certainly not the case.
      • Example: We scarcely ever meet.
    • Often - Frequently; many times.
      • Example: We will stay together although we often quarrel.
    • Sporadically - Occasionally or at irregular intervals.
      • Example: She attended lectures only sporadically.
    • Infrequently - Not often; rarely.
      • Example: She does play cricket, but very infrequently.
    • Rarely - To grow less in scope or intensity especially gradually.
      • Example: The police rarely shoot to kill.

Hence, the only possible answer is option 2.

Additional Information

  • The antonyms of the word 'Seldom' are "Often, Frequently, Generally".
  • The synonyms of the word 'Seldom' are "Scarcely, Sporadically, Rarely".

Choose the synonym of the word 'Commendable'.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is '​Admirable.'

Key Points

  • The word 'Commendable' means Deserving praise.
    • Example: Your enthusiasm is highly commendable.
  • Let's look at the meaning of the given options:-
    • Deplorable - Deserving criticism or condemnation.
      • Example: The inactivity of the government was deplorable.
    • Discreditable - Tending to bring harm to a reputation.
      • Example: She had been suspended from her job for discreditable behavior.
    • Despicable - Deserving hatred and contempt.
      • Example: Abusing a child is a despicable act.
    • Admirable - Arousing or deserving respect and approval.
      • Example: The soldiers showed admirable bravery.
    • Reprehensible - Morally wrong and deserving criticism.
      • Example: The violence by anti-government protestors was reprehensible.

Hence, the only possible answer is option 4.

Additional Information

  • The synonyms of the word 'Commendable' are "Admirable, Laudable, Praiseworthy".
  • The antonyms of the word 'Commendable' are "Deplorable, Discreditable, Reprehensible".

questions.question:
Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options:

Recognition very often goes to those at the top of the pecking order and stays there. Credit seldom trickles down to the worker at the bottom. The World Health Organization’s act of recognizing India’s ASHA (accredited social health activists) and the polio workers of Afghanistan is an attempt to right that wrong. It is a rare, and commendable doffing of the hat for workers at the very bottom of the rung, and gives credit where it is due. When WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus announced the names of six Global Health Leader awardees at the opening session of the World Health Assembly, over one million ASHAs and eight volunteer polio workers found themselves being counted amidst people leading from the front. The other awardees are Paul Farmer, co-founder of the NGO Partners in Health, Ahmed Hankir, a British-Lebanese psychiatrist, Ludmila Sofia Oliveira Varela, a youth sports advocate, and Yōhei Sasakawa, WHO’s Goodwill Ambassador for Leprosy Elimination. Dr. Tedros who picks the awardees himself said that the award recognizes those who have made an outstanding contribution to protecting and promoting health around the world, at a time when the world is facing an unprecedented convergence of inequity, conflict, food insecurity, climate crisis, and a pandemic.

The ASHAs were honored for their “crucial role in linking the community with the health system, to ensure those living in rural poverty can access primary health care services....” These workers, all women, faced harassment and violence for their work during the pandemic, well documented in the media. While the pandemic rewrote the rules, creating danger where mere routine existed, it must be stressed that in general, their job, which takes them into difficult-to-reach places and hostile communities, confers a measure of privations. Even as they contribute to better health outcomes, this workforce continues to protest across the country, for better remuneration, health benefits, and permanent posts. The eight volunteer polio workers of Afghanistan (four of them women) were shot and killed by gunmen in Takhar and Kunduz provinces in February 2022. Their work was crucial in a country where wild poliovirus type 1 is still circulating, WHO recorded. Clearly, certain kinds of basic public health work are fraught with perils on several continents across the world. It is the duty of the governmental agencies that employ them to ensure their welfare, safety, and security. While cheerleading about the award is rightfully reaching a crescendo, what matters is how the Indian government serves its last-mile health workers who are its feet on the ground, once the dust raised by their unexpected recognition has settled down.

According to the passage, what should be the duty of the governmental agencies towards the public health workers?
options: To ensure their welfare, safety, and security.
To ensure them a government job.
To undermine their welfare, safety, and security.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is '​​To ensure their welfare, safety, and security.'

Key Points

  • The given passage is all about the welfare, safety, and security of public health workers.
  • The second-last sentence of the second paragraph says "It is the duty of the governmental agencies that employ them to ensure their welfare, safety, and security''.
  • From the above sentence, we can say that according to the passage, the duty of the governmental agencies towards the public health workers should be to ensure their welfare, safety, and security.

Hence, the only possible answer is option 1.

Important Points

  • ​Given below are the points, we should keep in mind while solving questions of reading comprehension-
    • Identify the purpose of reading. Try to go through the question first and then the passage so that you can just focus on the things you need to look at in the passage.
    • Anticipate what may lie ahead. Look out for specific information in the passage.

Which of the following is/are correct according to the given passage?

A. Paul Farmer picks the Global Health Leader awardees himself.

B. Eight women polio workers in Afghanistan were shot and killed by gunmen.

C. Wild poliovirus type 1 is still circulating in Afghanistan.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'Only C.'

Key Points

  • The last sentence of the first paragraph says "Dr. Tedros who picks the awardees himself said that the award recognizes those who have made an outstanding contribution to protecting and promoting health around the world, at a time when the world is facing an unprecedented convergence of inequity, conflict, food insecurity, climate crisis, and a pandemic'' and the fifth sentence of the second paragraph says "The eight volunteer polio workers of Afghanistan (four of them women) were shot and killed by gunmen in Takhar and Kunduz provinces in February 2022''.
    • From the above sentences, we can say that statements A and B are incorrect according to the given passage.​
  • The sixth sentence of the second paragraph says ''Their work was crucial in a country where wild poliovirus type 1 is still circulating, WHO recorded.''
    • From the above sentence, we can say that statement C is correct according to the given passage.​​​

Hence, the only possible answer is option 5.

What is the central theme of the passage?
options: A reduction in the value of the health workers' overtime.
Better remuneration and safety guarantee for health workers.
The decline in the number of health workers.
Ensuring those living in rural poverty can access primary health care.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is '​​​Better remuneration and safety guarantee for health workers.'

Key Points

  • The fourth sentence of the second paragraph says ''Even as they contribute to better health outcomes, this workforce continues to protest across the country, for better remuneration, health benefits, and permanent posts'', the seventh sentence of the second paragraph says "Clearly, certain kinds of basic public health work are fraught with perils on several continents across the world'' and the eighth sentence of the second paragraph concludes "It is the duty of the governmental agencies that employ them to ensure their welfare, safety, and security''.
  • From the above sentences, we can say that the central theme of the passage is ''​​Better remuneration and safety guarantee for health workers.''
    ​

Hence, the only possible answer is option 3.

questions.question:
Read the sentence to find out whether there is any error in it. The error, if any, will be in one part of the sentence. The number of that part is the answer. If there is no error, the answer is (E). Ignore errors of punctuation, if any.

While the billionaire wanting his (A)/ new skyscraper to connote grandness, (B)/ it only served to highlight his (C)/ ego and wasteful spending habits. (D)/ No error (E)
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 1, i.e., 'While the billionaire wanting his'.

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in the past tense. The word 'wanting' expresses the present tense thus, making the sentence grammatically incorrect.
  • To correct the sentence, the word 'wanting' should be replaced with 'wanted', which expresses the past tense.

The correct sentence is:

While the billionaire wanted his new skyscraper to connote grandness, it only served to highlight his ego and wasteful spending habits.

questions.question:
Read the sentence to find out whether there is any error in it. The error, if any, will be in one part of the sentence. The number of that part is the answer. If there is no error, the answer is (5). Ignore errors of punctuation, if any.

Terrorist investigators commonly use tactics of (A)/ disinformation by lying about the evidence they (B)/ have found or witnesses they have been(C)/ interviewed in order to get a confession. (D)/ No error (E)
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 3, i.e., 'have found or witnessed they have been'.

Key Points

  • The given sentence is in the simple present tense. The phrase 'have been' indicates the present perfect tense. The present perfect tense describes an action that began in the past, continues in the present, and may continue into the future. Thus, the use of the phrase 'have been' makes the sentence grammatically incorrect.
  • To correct the sentence, 'have been' should be replaced with 'have', which simply expresses the present tense.

The correct sentence is:

Terrorist investigators commonly use tactics of disinformation by lying about the evidence they have found or witnesses they have interviewed in order to get a confession.

questions.question:
Read the sentence to find out whether there is any error in it. The error, if any, will be in one part of the sentence. The number of that part is the answer. If there is no error, the answer is (5). Ignore errors of punctuation, if any.

Mothers will instinctively shelter their (1)/ babies from anything bad because (2)/ it is natural on them (3)/ to protect their children. (4)/ No error (5)
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 3, i.e., 'it is natural on them'.

The preposition 'on' means 'above'. It does not fit the context of the sentence and makes it grammatically incorrect.

To correct the sentence, the preposition 'on' should be replaced with 'for', which means 'suiting the purpose of'.

The correct sentence is:

Mothers will instinctively shelter their babies from anything bad because it is natural for them to protect their children.

questions.question:
In the sentence, certain words are in bold and numbered from A to E, which are the possible pairs to be interchanged. Choose the pair(s) of words which need to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically correct and meaningful.

When, however, the human mind was (A) illumined by the torch-light of science, it came to understand that the Earth was but one of a (B) speck of stars (C) floating in (D) infinite space, a mere (E) myriad of dust.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 4) i.e. B-E.

Let us look at the sentence in the following way-

When, however, the human mind was (A) ________ by the torch-light of science, it came to understand that the Earth was but one of a (B) ________of stars (C) ________ in (D) ________space, a mere (E) ________ of dust.

  • It is clear that A and C are correct and D justifies the bold word.
  • We cannot use speck with stars as stars are not substances. Also, dust cannot be counted so we cannot use myriad. We need to interchange B and E to make the sentence correct.

Additional Information

Meanings of the words given in bold are:

  • Illumined means light up; brighten.
  • Myriad means a countless or extremely great number of people or things.
  • Speck means a small particle of a substance.
  • Floating means moving or hovering slowly and lightly in a liquid or the air; drift.
  • Infinite means limitless or endless in space, extent, or size; impossible to measure or calculate.

Corrected sentence - 'When, however, the human mind was (A) illumined by the torch-light of science, it came to understand that the Earth was but one of a (B) myriad of stars (C) floating in (D) infinite space, a mere (E) speck of dust.'

questions.question:
In the sentence, certain words are in bold and numbered from A to E, which are the possible pairs to be interchanged. Choose the pair(s) of words which need to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically correct and meaningful.

There are also certain (A) crawling creatures which are so (B) notoriously the children of (C) shrink and so (D) threatening in their touch that we naturally (E) filth from them.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 3) C-E.

Let us look at the sentence in the following way-

There are also certain (A) _________ creatures which are so (B) _________ the children of (C) _________ and so (D) _________ in their touch that we naturally (E) _________ from them.

  • It is clear that A and B are correct. Also, D justifies the bold word.
  • E requires a verb as it means that we move away from such creatures. C requires a noun that can be used for such creatures. We need to interchange C-E to make the sentence correct.

Additional Information

Meanings of the words given in bold are:

  • Crawling means moving forward by dragging the body close to the ground.
  • Notoriously means famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed.
  • Shrink means move back or away, especially because of fear or disgust.
  • Threatening means scary; fearsome.
  • Filth means disgusting dirt.

Corrected sentence - 'There are also certain (A) crawling creatures which are so (B) notoriously the children of (C) filth and so (D) threatening in their touch that we naturally (E) shrink from them.'

questions.question:
In the sentence, certain words are in bold and numbered from A to E, which are the possible pairs to be interchanged.Choose the pair(s) of words which need to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically correct and meaningful.

(A) Communities flooding (B) disruption caused (C) significant distress and (D) unfortunately for (E) recent and businesses.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 4), i.e. B-D and A-E.

We can go through the sentence in the following way:

(A)________ flooding (B)________ caused (C)________ distress and (D)_________ for (E)________ and businesses.

Communities means groups or sections.It is inappropriately used here. Recent (meaning : happening or starting from a short time ago) is also not the proper word here- if considered contextually .So A and E should be interchanged.

Disruption means disturbance.This word is contextually incorrect and should be used after 'and' because flooding has caused disturbance or disruption.

Unfortunately means sadly and this word can be written before the word 'caused'. So, B and D should be interchanged.

The correct answer:

(A) Recent flooding (B) unfortunately caused (C) significant distress and (D) disruption for (E) communities and businesses.

questions.question:
In the sentence, certain words are in bold and numbered from A to E, which are the possible pairs to be interchanged.Choose the pair(s) of words which need to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically correct and meaningful.

Tobacco plants (A) offer the (B) potential for faster and (C) conventional vaccine (D) development compared with (E) safer methods.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 4), i.e. C-E.

Key Points

We can go through the sentence in the following way:

Tobacco plants (A)________ the (B)________ for faster and (C)________ vaccine (D)________ compared with (E)________ methods.

Potential means capacity.

Development means growth and enlargement.

Clearly, B and D have meaningful words. A is also correct.

Conventional means 'traditional' and it should not be used here in blank (C). Safer should be written here which is an adjective in the comparative degree like the word faster.

Hence, C and E should be interchanged.

The correct sentence:

Tobacco plants (A) offer the (B) potential for faster and (C) safer vaccine (D) development compared with (E) conventional methods.

questions.question:
In the following passage, some of the words have been left out. Read the passage carefully and select the correct answer for the given blanks out of the given alternatives.

The farmers began camping in the outskirts of Delhi when the first wave of the pandemic was past its _____ (1). They upped the ante in the next four months and did not backtrack even after the virus ______ (2) with a vengeance. By the Morcha’s own admission, some 470 farmers have ____ (3) their lives — it is not clear how many of those deaths were due to Covid. Any swelling of the ranks of the protesters now carries the risk of _____ (4) the health crisis, especially with the virus mutating into a more infectious variant. The ____ (5) farmers risk harming not just themselves but carrying the contagion back to their villages and risking the lives of their family members, friends, neighbors, and co-workers. This could present another set of ______ (6) for the overworked doctors, nurses, healthcare professionals, and testing and contact tracing teams.

What will come in blank 1?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'peak'.

Key Points

  • The most appropriate answer is peak.
  • Peak means the point at which something is the highest, best, strongest, etc.
  • Example-
    • She's at the peak of her career.
    • Holiday flights reach a peak during August.
  • Wave, height, time, and period are not appropriate answers.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 3.

questions.question:

The farmers began camping in the outskirts of Delhi when the first wave of the pandemic was past its _____ (1). They upped the ante in the next four months and did not backtrack even after the virus ______ (2) with a vengeance. By the Morcha’s own admission, some 470 farmers have ____ (3) their lives — it is not clear how many of those deaths were due to Covid. Any swelling of the ranks of the protesters now carries the risk of _____ (4) the health crisis, especially with the virus mutating into a more infectious variant. The ____ (5) farmers risk harming not just themselves but carrying the contagion back to their villages and risking the lives of their family members, friends, neighbors, and co-workers. This could present another set of ______ (6) for the overworked doctors, nurses, healthcare professionals, and testing and contact tracing teams.

What will come in blank 2?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'returned'.

Key Points

  • Returned means to come or go back to a place.
    • Example- I leave on 10 July and return on 6 August.
  • Returned is the most appropriate answer.
  • The correct sentence- 'They upped the ante in the next four months and did not backtrack even after the virus returned with a vengeance.'
  • Began (It is the past tense of begin) means to start doing something.
  • Departed (past tense of depart) means to leave a place, usually at the beginning of a journey.
  • Disappeared (past tense of disappear) means to vanish, to become impossible to see or to find, to stop existing.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

questions.question:

Any swelling of the ranks of the protesters now carries the risk of _____ (4) the health crisis, especially with the virus mutating into a more infectious variant. The ____ (5) farmers risk harming not just themselves but carrying the contagion back to their villages and risking the lives of their family members, friends, neighbors, and co-workers. This could present another set of ______ (6) for the overworked doctors, nurses, healthcare professionals, and testing and contact tracing teams.

What will come in blank 3?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'lost'.

Key Points

  • Lost means unable to find your way; not knowing where you are; that cannot be found or that no longer exists.
  • The sentence is talking about farmers losing their lives. So , the most appropriate answer is 'lost'.
  • Gained means to obtain or win something, especially something that you need or want; to gradually get more of something.
  • Vanish means to get to disappear suddenly or in a way that you cannot explain.
  • Also, we do not use 'vanish their lives', it'll be incorrect. The proper usage is 'lost their lives'.
  • Find means to discover something that you want or that you have lost after searching for it.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 2.

questions.question:
In the following passage, some of the words have been left out. Read the passage carefully and select the correct answer for the given blanks out of the given alternatives.

The farmers began camping in the outskirts of Delhi when the first wave of the pandemic was past its _____ (1). They upped the ante in the next four months and did not backtrack even after the virus ______ (2) with a vengeance. By the Morcha’s own admission, some 470 farmers have ____ (3) their lives — it is not clear how many of those deaths were due to Covid. Any swelling of the ranks of the protesters now carries the risk of _____ (4) the health crisis, especially with the virus mutating into a more infectious variant. The ____ (5) farmers risk harming not just themselves but carrying the contagion back to their villages and risking the lives of their family members, friends, neighbors, and co-workers. This could present another set of ______ (6) for the overworked doctors, nurses, healthcare professionals, and testing and contact tracing teams.

What will come in blank 4?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'aggravating'.

Key Points

  • Aggravating means to make a situation worse; to make something worse or more serious; to make somebody angry or annoyed.
  • 'Lessen', 'mitigate', 'conciliate' are all antonyms of 'aggravate'.
  • Lessen means to become less; to make something less.
  • Conciliate- to try to make a group of people less angry, especially in order to end a dispute.
  • Mitigate- to make something less serious, painful, unpleasant, etc.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 4.

questions.question:
In the following passage, some of the words have been left out. Read the passage carefully and select the correct answer for the given blanks out of the given alternatives.

The farmers began camping in the outskirts of Delhi when the first wave of the pandemic was past its _____ (1). They upped the ante in the next four months and did not backtrack even after the virus ______ (2) with a vengeance. By the Morcha’s own admission, some 470 farmers have ____ (3) their lives — it is not clear how many of those deaths were due to Covid. Any swelling of the ranks of the protesters now carries the risk of _____ (4) the health crisis, especially with the virus mutating into a more infectious variant. The ____ (5) farmers risk harming not just themselves but carrying the contagion back to their villages and risking the lives of their family members, friends, neighbors, and co-workers. This could present another set of ______ (6) for the overworked doctors, nurses, healthcare professionals, and testing and contact tracing teams.

What will come in blank 6?
questions.solution:
The correct answer is 'challenges'.

Key Points

  • Challenges is the most appropriate word for the given blank.
  • Challenges mean something new and difficult that forces you to make a lot of effort.
    • Example- Are you prepared for the challenges ahead?
  • Problems a thing that is difficult to deal with or to understand.
  • Investigations the action of investigating something or someone; formal or systematic examination or research.
  • Obstacles are something that makes it difficult for you to do something or go somewhere.
  • Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

questions.question:
A sentence/part of the sentence is emboldened. Five alternatives are given to the emboldened part which will improve the sentence. Choose the correct alternative and choose the option corresponding to it. In case no improvement is needed, click the option corresponding to “no improvement required”

The recent fire incidence in Surat cannot be called an accident since there are reported notice having been served to the builder on the risks, but not pursued by the Fire Department.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is option 3 i.e. reports of notices.

Key Points

  • “reports of notices” is the correct phrase instead of reported notice.
  • The sentence requires a plural for the word “notice” which is notices considering the plethora of information given to the builder prior to the incidence.
  • This is further emphasized by “reports” the correct noun form prior to the action of serving the notice to the builder.

Correct answer : "The recent fire incidence in Surat cannot be called an accident since there are reports of notices having been served to the builder on the risks, but not pursued by the Fire Department."

questions.question:
A sentence/part of the sentence is emboldened. Five alternatives are given to the emboldened part which will improve the sentence. Choose the correct alternative and choose the option corresponding to it. In case no improvement is needed, click the option corresponding to “no improvement required”

Claimed through EU Member States by disappointed energy sector investors have been a major growth industry in recent years.
questions.solution:
The correct answer is Option 3.
Key Points
  • The original sentence is awkwardly phrased and does not clearly convey the meaning. The main issue is the placement and form of the words at the beginning of the sentence, making it hard to understand who is doing what.
  • Option 3, "Claims against EU Member States," correctly reformulates the sentence to clearly indicate that the claims are directed against EU Member States by disappointed energy sector investors. This option corrects the grammatical structure and improves clarity.
  • The original sentence's structure makes it difficult to immediately grasp the subject and object, which is clarified by the correct option.
Therefore, the correct answer is ‘Claims against EU Member States’.
Additional Information
  • Option 1, "Claims against EU Members State," incorrectly uses "State" in the singular form where the plural is needed, as it is referring to multiple EU Member States.
  • Option 2, "Claims against EU Members States," is grammatically incorrect due to the unnecessary plural form of "Members" when it should be "Member States" to correctly refer to the states as members of the EU.
  • Option 4, "Claim against EU Member States," uses the singular "Claim" which is less accurate since the context suggests a trend of multiple claims rather than a singular instance.

questions.question: The speed of the boat in still water is 15 kmph and the speed of the current is 9 kmph. It travels 6 km more downstream than upstream. The difference between the time taken by boat to travel upstream and downstream is 5 hours. Find the total distance traveled by boat.
questions.solution:
Given:

Speed of a boat in still water = 15 kmph

Speed of the current = 9 kmph

Formula:

Speed downstream = Speed of a boat in still water + speed of a stream

Speed upstream = Speed of a boat in still water – the speed of a stream

Calculation:

Let distance traveled in downstream be A km.

Upstream distance travelled by boat = (A – 6)km

Speed downstream = 15 + 9 = 24 kmph

Speed upstream = 15 – 9 = 6 kmph

Then,

⇒ (A – 6)/6 – A/24 = 5

⇒ 24A – 144 – 6A = 720

⇒ A = 48km

Downstream distance = 48km

Upstream distance = 48 – 6 = 42 km

∴ Total distance travelled by boat = 48 + 42 = 90 km

questions.question: A milkman mixed water in milk due to which the ratio of milk and water in the mixture became 7 : 3, and the total quantity of mixture is 60 litres and he sells it at the rate of Rs. 35/litre. If the cost price of milk is Rs. 30/litre and cost of water is zero, find the overall profit%.
questions.solution:
Given:

Quantity of mixture = 60 litres

Ratio of Milk to water = 7 : 3

Cost price of milk = Rs. 30/litre

Selling price of mixture = Rs. 35/litre

Formula used:

Gain% = (Gain/C.P) × 100%

Calculation:

Total quantity of mixture = 60 litres

Quantity of Milk = (7/10) × 60

⇒ 42 litres

S.P of Mixture = Rs. (60 × 35) = Rs. 2100

C.P of 42 litres milk = Rs. (42 × 30) = Rs. 1260

Gain = Rs. (2100 – 1260)

⇒ Rs. 840

Gain% = (840/1260) × 100%

⇒ 200/3

∴ The overall profit% is 200/3%

questions.question:
What will come in the place of 't' in the following question?

50% of 300 + (3/5) of 200 - 80 + t = 300

What value will come in the place of the question mark ‘?’ in the following question?

5265 ÷ 117 + 67 × 85 - 1172 + 289 + 263 - 120 = (?)
questions.solution:
Concept used:

Follow BODMAS rule to solve this question, as per the order given below.

Step - 1: Parts of an equation enclosed in 'Brackets' must be solved second, and following BODMAS rule in the bracket

Step - 2: Any mathematical 'Of' or 'Exponent' must be solved next.

Step - 3: Next, the parts of the equation that contain 'Division' and 'Multiplication' are calculated.

Step - 4: Last but not least, the parts of the equation that contain 'Addition' and 'Subtraction' should be calculated.

Calculations:

5265 ÷ 117 + 67 × 85 - 1172 + 289 + 263 - 120 = (?)

⇒ 45 + 5695 - 1172 + 289 + 263 - 120 = (?)

⇒ 45 + 5695 - 1172 + 289 + 263 - 120 = (?)

⇒ 6292 - 1292 = (?)

⇒ ? = 5000

Hence, the correct answer is 5000.

questions.question:
What should come in the place of the question mark '?' in the following question?

12.5% of 384 - 16.66% of 66 = √16 + √? + 22
questions.solution:
The correct answer is: 3

Given:

12.5% of 384 - 16.66% of 66 = √16 + √? + 22

Concept used:

the BODMAS rule should be followed as per the given table:

calculation:

12.5% of 384 - 16.66% of 66 = √16 + √? + 22

1/8 of 384 - 1/6 of 66 = 4 + √? + 4 { 12.5% = 1/8 and 16.66% = 1/6}

48 - 11 = 8 + √?

37 = 8 + √?

⇒ √? = 29

or ? = 841

∴ the value of ? is 841

questions.question:
What will come in the place of the question mark ‘?’ in the following question?

15 × √16 – 30% of 200 = 25% of 80 + ? × 20
questions.solution:
Given:

15 × √16 – 30% of 200 = 25% of 80 + ? × 20

Concept used:

Follow the BODMAS rule according to the table given below:

Calculation:

15 × √16 – 30% of 200 = 25% of 80 + ? × 20

⇒ 15 × 4 – (30/100) × 200 = (25/100) × 80 + ? × 20

⇒ 60 - 60 = 20 + ? × 20

⇒ 0 - 20 = ? × 20

⇒ ? = -20/20 = -1

∴ The value of ? is -1

questions.question:
What should come in place of the question mark (?) in the following question?

(12)3 ÷ 4 + 15 × 13 - ? + 4 = 21 × 30
questions.solution:
Given:

(12)3 ÷ 4 + 15 × 13 - ? + 4 = 21 × 30

Concept used:

Follow the BODMAS rule according to the table given below:

Calculation:

(12)3 ÷ 4 + 15 × 13 - ? + 4 = 21 × 30

⇒ 1728 ÷ 4 + 195 - ? + 4 = 630

⇒ 432 + 195 + 4 - ? = 630

⇒ ? = 631 - 630

⇒ ? = 1

∴ 1 should come in place of the question mark (?).

questions.question:
Directions: Data of six towns is given. In the first pie chart distribution of population with respect to six towns. In the second pie chart number of the male population is given. People are categorized as male and female only. Solve the question related to the pie chart given. 

Note: Total population of town C is 2184 more than the total population of town B.

Note: Male population of B is 936 less than the male population of town C.

What is the number of female population in the town C and D together?
questions.solution:
Calculation:

Let x be the total number of population

Total number of population = (21/100)x – (15/100)x = 2184

⇒ (6/100)x = 2184

⇒ x = (218400/6) = 36400

Let y be the total male population

Total male population = (24/100)y – (18/100)y = 936

⇒ (6/100)y = 936

⇒ y = (93600/6) = 15600

Total number of female population in town C and D = 3900 + 3328 = 7228

∴ The total number of female population in town C and D is 7228.

questions.question:
Find the wrong term in the following series.

20790, 20790, 6930, 1386, 198, 23, 2
questions.solution:
Given:

20790, 20790, 6930, 1386, 198, 23, 2

Calculation:

The series follows the following pattern:

⇒ 20790 ÷ 1 = 20790

⇒ 20790 ÷ 3 = 6930

⇒ 6930 ÷ 5 = 1386

⇒ 1386 ÷7 = 198

⇒ 198 ÷ 9 = 22

⇒ 22 ÷11 = 2

The wrong term is 23.

Hence, the wrong term in the series is 23.

questions.question:
In the following number series, a wrong number is given. Find out the wrong number.

870, 855, 840, 825, 810, 800
questions.solution:
Given:

870, 855, 840, 825, 810, 800

Calculation:

The logic follows here is;

870 - 15 = 855

855 - 15 = 840

840 - 15 = 825

825 - 15 = 810

810 - 15 = 795 ≠ 800

There should be 795 instead of 800.

∴ 800 is the wrong term.

Since 216 will come in place of 36,

∴ The required wrong number will be 36.

questions.question: A lapidary breaks a stone into three pieces. The weight of the first piece is thrice that of the second piece and the weight of the third piece is twice that of the second piece. If the initial weight of the stone was 18 grams. What is the weight of the heaviest piece?
questions.solution:
Given:

Weight of the stone = 18 grams

Concept used:

If A : B and B : C

Then combine both ratios by equating the values

A : B : C

Calculation:

Let the first piece be x

Let the second piece be y

Let the third piece be z

x = 3 × y

z = 2 × y

The ratio of x, y and z = 3 : 1 : 2

Weight of the heaviest piece = [18/(3 + 1 + 2)] × 3

⇒ (18/6) × 3 = 9

∴ The weight of the heaviest piece is 9 grams.

questions.question: There are 10 males and 8 females in a company. At random, three employees were chosen. The difference in the probability of selecting 2 males and 1 females against 1 male and 2 females is:
questions.solution:
Given:

Total males = 10

Total females = 8

Total employees to be chosen = 3

Calculation:

Probability of selecting 2 males and 1 females = (10C2 × 8C1)/(18C3)

⇒ ÷

⇒ (45 × 8) ÷ (3 × 17 × 16)

⇒ 15/34

Probability of selecting 1 male and 2 females = (10C1 × 8C2)/(18C3)

⇒ ÷

⇒ (10 × 28) ÷ (3 × 17 × 16)

⇒ 35/102

Required difference = (15/34) - (35/102)

⇒ 10/102

∴ The difference in the probability of selecting 2 males and 1 females against 1 male and 2 females is 10/102.

questions.question: Ram lent Rs.2.7 lakh amount to Pawan and Pooja in ratio of 5 : 4, Pawan and Pooja payback its amount after 3 years at 10% and 15% annual compound interest respectively, At the end of time duration the amount received by Ram from Pawan was how much more than that received from Pooja?
questions.solution:
Given:

Ram lent Rs.2.7 lakh amount to Pawan and Pooja

Lent money to Pawan and Pooja in ratio of 5 : 4

Pooja payback its amount after 3 years at 10% annual compound interest

Pawan payback its amount after 3 year at 15% annual compound interest

Concept:

A = P × (1 + R/100)T

A = Final amount

P = Initial amount

R = Rate of interest

T = Time

Calculation:

Lent money to Pawan and Pooja in ratio of 5 : 4

Lent by Pawan = (5/9) × 270000

⇒ Rs.1,50,000

Lent by Pooja = (4/9) × 270000

⇒ Rs.1,20,000

Pawan payback to Ram = 150000 × (1 + 10/100)3

⇒ 150000 × (11/10) × (11/10) × (11/10)

⇒ Rs.1,99,650

Pooja payback to Ram = 120000 × (1 + 15/100)3

⇒ 120000 × (23/20)3

⇒ 120000 × (23/20) × (23/20) × (23/20)

⇒ Rs.1,82,505

Pawan payback to Ram – Pooja payback to Ram = 199650 – 182505

⇒ Rs.17,145

∴ At the end of time duration the amount received by Ram from Pawan was Rs.17145 more than that received from Pooja.

questions.question: There are two containers A and B having colors white and blue respectively. The quantity of pure water in both the container are 60% and 70% respectively. If 2 liters of white color and 3 liters of blue color is mixed. What will be the quantity of water in the final mixture?
questions.solution:
Given:

Percentage of water in the white color = 60%

Percentage of water in the blue color = 70%

Formula used:

Weighted average = Sum of weighted terms/Number of terms

Calculation:

Let x be the percentage of water in the final mixture

(60/100) × 2 + (70/100) × 3 = (2 + 3) × (x/100)

⇒ 1.2 + 2.1 = 5 × (x/100)

⇒ x = (3.3 × 100)/5

⇒ x = 66%

∴ The percentage of water in the final mixture is 66%.

⇒ (70 - x)/(x - 60) = 2/3

⇒ 210 - 3x = 2x - 120

⇒ 5x = 330

⇒ x = (330/5) = 66%

∴ The percentage of water in the final mixture is 66%.

questions.question:
Direction: Read the given information carefully and answer the following questions:

Seven persons viz. Azim, Bindu, Chaitra, Delphin, Eza, Fath, and Gayl buy different dresses viz. Jean, Shirt, Kurta, Skirt, Saree, Salwar and Dhoti. The number of dresses bought by each of them is in the consecutive multiples of 3. All the information is not necessarily in the same order. The total number of dresses bought by all people cannot exceed 85.

The number of Sarees bought is twice the number of Shirts bought which, is not bought by Azim. Gayl bought dresses twice the number of dresses bought by Delphin. Neither Azim nor Bindu bought 18 dresses. Chaitra bought the highest number of dresses but neither bought Saree nor Salwar. Delphin bought a number of Jeans, which is higher than only Fath. Either Shirt or Dhoti is bought for the lowest number. Either Eza or Gayl bought 12 Skirts. Saree is bought for the second highest number. Neither Azim nor Bindu bought Kurta, which is bought for the number more than Sarees.

Which dress does Azim bought?
questions.solution:
Persons: Azim, Bindu, Chaitra, Delphin, Eza, Fath, and Gayl

Dresses: Jean, Shirt, Kurta, Skirt, Saree, Salwar and Dhoti

Number of dresses: The number of dresses bought by each of them are in the consecutive multiples of 3. The total number of dresses bought by all people cannot exceed 85.

So, 3, 6, 9, 12, 15, 18 and 21 are the number of dresses bought by them.

1. Either Eza or Gayl bought 12 Skirts.

2. Delphin bought a number of Jeans, which is higher than only Fath.

3. So Fath bought 3 dresses and Delphin bought 6 jeans.

4. The number of Sarees bought is twice the number of Shirts bought.

5. Saree is bought for the second highest number. So, number of Saree is 18 and Shirt is 9.

6. Gayl bought twice the number of dresses of Delphin. So, Case 1 is invalid.

6. Chaithra bought the highest number of dresses but neither bought Saree nor Salwar.

So, the number is 21 and the dress left for it is Kurta.

7. Either Shirt or Dhoti is bought for the lowest number.

As Shirt is already 9, so the number of Dhoti bought is 3.

8. The number of Sarees bought is twice the number of Shirts bought, which is not bought by Azim.

So, he bought 15 salwar.

9. Neither Azim nor Bindu bought 18 dresses.

10. Saree is bought for the second highest number. So, number of Saree is 18 and Shirt is 9.

The final arrangement is,

So, Azim bought Salwar.

questions.solution:

If all the odd digits are increased by 2, then

Now all the digits are arranged in ascending order from the left end -

2233445667779

questions.question:
Directions: In the question below are given three statements followed by three conclusions I, II and III. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance from commonly known facts. Read all the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statements:

All apples are fruits.

Some fruits are green.

No green are vegetables.

Conclusions:

I. Some apples are green.

II. Some fruits are not vegetables.

III. No apples are vegetables.
options: All I, II and III follows
questions.solution:
The least possible diagram for the given statements is as follows:

Conclusions:

I. Some apples are green. → False (This conclusion cannot be definitively proven from the given statements. Although some fruits are green and all apples are fruits, it doesn't necessarily mean that some apples are green. There could be other green fruits, but the premises don't provide enough information to conclude that some apples are green. So, this conclusion not follows.)

II. Some fruits are not vegetables. → True (Since some fruits are green and no green are vegetables, it follows that the green fruits are not vegetables. Therefore, this conclusion follows.)

III. No apples are vegetables. → False (All apples are fruits, and while the premises don't specifically state that no fruits are vegetables, the fact that no green are vegetables suggests that there might be some separation between fruits and vegetables. However, this isn't enough information to conclude that no apples are vegetables. We would need more information to draw this conclusion, so this conclusion not follow.)

Hence, Only conclusion II follows.

questions.question:
Directions: In the question below are given statements followed by conclusions. You have to take the given statements to be true even if they seem to be at variance with commonly known facts. Read all the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the given statements disregarding commonly known facts.

Statement:

I. Only a few Radio are TV

II. Only a few Laptop are Cable

III. All Cables are TV

Conclusion:

I. All Laptop being Cable is a possibility

II. Some Radio being Cable is a possibility

III. All Radio are Laptop
options: Both III and II follow
Both I and II follow
questions.solution:
The least possible Venn diagram according to the above statement is:

I. All Laptop being Cable is a possibility → False (As only a few Laptops are Cables, hence the possibility of all will be false.)

II. Some Radio being Cable is a possibility → True (Some Radio being Cable is definitely a possibility as no direct relation is given between them.)

III. All Radio are Laptop → False (All Radio being Laptop is a possibility but its not definite.)

Hence, Only II follows is the correct answer.

Hence, the correct answer is Only I follows.

Ten persons – M, N, O, P, Q, R, S, T, U and V are living in five different floors of a building. Ground floor numbered as 1 and top floor is numbered as 5. There are two flats on each floor- flat-1 and flat-2 from west to east such that flat-1 is to the west of flat-2. Flat-1 of second floor is exactly above flat-1 of first floor and exactly below flat-1 of third floor and other flats are placed in the same way but not necessarily in the same order.

V lives on an odd numbered floor but dose not lives on an even numbered flat. More than one floor is there between the floor of M and the floor on which N lives. U lives to the east of V on the same floor. One floor is there between V who is not on the lowermost floor and the floor on which R lives, both lives on the same flat number. M lives to the west of P and dose not lives on an even numbered floor. O who lives to the North-West of T is not on the fifth floor. Only one floor gap is there between the floor of Q and the floor on which S lives. T is not an immediate neighbour of S. M does not live above Q.

Who among the following lives on Floor-2, Flat-2?
questions.solution:
Given:

Ten persons: M, N, O, P, Q, V, W, X, Y and Z

Five different floors of a building

Two flats: flat-1 and flat-2 from west to east such that flat-1 is to the west of flat-2.

Now,

1) V lives on an odd numbered floor but dose not lives on an even numbered flat.

2) More than one floor is there between the floor of M and the floor on which N lives.

3) U lives to the east of V on the same floor.

4) One floor is there between V who is not on the lowermost floor and the floor on which R lives, both lives on the same flat number.

5) M lives to the west of P and dose not lives on an even numbered floor.

As V cannot be on the lowermost floor thus, CASE 1 gets eliminated

6) O who lives to the North-West of T is not on the fifth floor.

7) Only one floor gap is there between the floor of Q and the floor on which S lives.

8) T is not an immediate neighbour of S. M does not live above Q.

More than one floor is there between the floor of M and the floor on which N lives, also, M lives to the west of P and dose not lives on an even numbered floor.

In CASE 3, there is not a gap of more than one floor between M and N, thus CASE 3 gets eliminated.

In CASE 1(a), we are not getting the exact position of Q and S, but in CASE 2 all the conditions of the question are being fulfilled, thus we have the final arrangement in CASE 2.

Hence, the correct answer is "T".

Directions: Study the following information carefully to answer the given questions:

Ten Candidates are sitting in two parallel rows in such a way that in Row 1 A, B, C, D, and E are sitting facing south, and in Row 2 P, Q, R, S, and T are sitting facing north. B sits to the left of A. Two persons sit between R and T. One persons sit between D and E, who does not sit next to C. At most two person sits right of D. S sits three places away from Q. The number of persons sitting to the right of A is equal to the number of persons sitting to the right of Q. The person who sits opposite to T sits four places away from C. A sits second from the end. T sits to the right of S. D sits Immediate next to the one who is facing Q. 

How many person are sitting in between One who faces A and one who faces E?
options: One who faces A is immediate left of one who faces E
One who faces A is immediate right of one who faces E
questions.solution:
Row 1 A, B, C, D, and E are sitting facing south
Row 2 P, Q, R, S, and T are sitting facing north.

1. A sits second from the end.

2.The number of persons sitting to the right of A is equal to the number of persons sitting to the right of Q.

3. D sits Immediate next to the one who is facing Q.

4. One persons sit between D and E, who does not sit next to C.

5. S sits three places away from Q. T sits to the right of S. Hence Case 2.1A, case 2.1 and Case 2 gets eliminated.

6. Two persons sit between R and T. The person who sits opposite to T sits four places away from C. Case 1.1 gets eliminated.

7.B sits to the left of A. At most two person sits right of D. Hence case 1 gets eliminated

Final arrangement

One who faces A is R and One who faces E is T hence two person sits in between them.
